intro: Fernandezia amboroensis var. obovata, commonly known as the Amboró fern, is a rare and unique plant species native to the cloud forests of Bolivia. It belongs to the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, obovate-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or rocky surfaces, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of its habitat. Its foliage is covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs, which help retain moisture in its moist environment. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered a vulnerable species.
